bug.short_desc: Need better mathematics in built in Disease models

long_desc.thetext: Spread is much too fast Model for population mixing needs to be refined Model for transport needs to be refined

Created attachment 86749 Fixes math, mixing math, tests, and javadoc
still need to add better transport math

Dan, Please assign this bug to me. The patch attached fixes the worst problem in the mathematics, namely the normalization of beta*S*I which was off by a factor of 1/Population. This fixes the problem in the population spread where 100% of people get sick instantly. I also added Jusin's improved model for mixing between physically adjacent locations I refactored (renamed) some methods, fixed the javadoc, rebuilt the models as needed, and updated the JUnit tests. in this first patch.
Jamie, the disease spread is very slow and very limited with the changes in this patch. Is this to be expected?

Created attachment 86861 Replaces first patch
better javadoc eliminate unnecessary helper method better comments
